NPosition Type Non-Management메리어트 인터내셔널은 기회 균등 고용주로서 모두를 환영하고 기회에 대한 접근성을 제공하기 위해 최선을 다하고 있습니다. 우리는 직원 개개인의 고유한 배경을 가치 있게 여기고 존중하는 환경을 적극적으로 조성합니다. 우리의 최대 강점은 직원들의 문화, 재능, 경험이 풍부하게 어우러져 있다는 점입니다. 우리는 장애인, 재향군인 및 관련 법률이 보호하는 기타 모든 기준을 포함하여, 어떠한 보호 대상 기준에 대해서도 차별하지 않기 위해 최선을 다하고 있습니다.전 세계 100개 이상의 수상 경력에 빛나는 리츠칼튼은 고객이 머무른 후에도 오래도록 기억에 남을 특별한 경험을 선사합니다. 리츠칼튼은 우리를 찾는 고객들이 평생 좋은 추억을 간직할 수 있도록 세계 최고의 호스피탈리티 전문가들을 영입하고 있으며, 창의적이고, 사려 깊고, 열정적인 태도를 지닌 사람이라면 모두가 성공할 수 있다고 믿습니다.하루도 빠짐 없이 희소성과 특별함이 있는 럭셔리 서비스의 기준을 세우고 전 세계 고객에게 보살핌과 편안함을 드리기 위해 탁월한 서비스를 제공하는 것에 자부심을 느끼고 있습니다.여러분의 역할은리츠칼튼의 '골드 스탠다드(Gold Standards)'를 고객에게 매일 우아하고 사려 깊게 전달하는 것입니다. 골드 스탠다드는 리츠칼튼의 근간이며, 매일 우리가 지난 날보다 더 나은 사람이 되도록 인도하는 역할이 되어줍니다. 리츠칼튼을 성공적으로 이끈 문화, 즉 고객 서비스에 대한 토대와 신념을 통해 럭셔리 호스피탈리티 분야의 글로벌 브랜드 리더로서의 명성을 얻었습니다. 우리 팀의 일원으로서 여러분은 직원 약속, 신조 및 서비스 가치와 같은 골드 스탠다드에 대해 배우고 모범을 보일 것입니다. 리츠칼튼은 여러분이 하는 일과 여러분이 함께 일하는 사람들에 대해 자부심을 기회를 약속 드립니다.리츠칼튼에 입사하면 메리어트 인터내셔널의 브랜드 포트폴리오에 합류하게 됩니다. 최선 을 다해 일하고, 목표 를 향해 달리며, 훌륭한 글로벌 팀의 일원으 로 최고의 나를 만들고 싶다면 리츠칼튼의 문을 두드리세요. job_description: The Total Rewards Supervisor supports the design, implementation, and governance of the organization’s total rewards framework, including compensation structures, job evaluation, incentives, and benefits. The role ensures internal equity, external competitiveness, budget discipline, and data accuracy, while supervising day-to-day total rewards operations and supporting annual and ad-hoc reward processes.Job Evaluation & Role Mapping Conduct job evaluation and job mapping exercises using approved methodologies to ensure roles are aligned with the organizational grading and job architecture framework. Maintain accurate job maps and collaborate with Talent Management team to reflect organizational changes. Ensure job evaluation outputs support internal equity and consistency across functions. Compensation Planning & Budgeting Prepare, monitor, and control headcount and compensation budgets in coordination with Finance and HR leadership. Support workforce planning through accurate compensation forecasting and scenario analysis. Monitor budget utilization and highlight deviations with corrective recommendations. Annual & Variable Pay Processes Manage and coordinate annual total rewards cycles, including merit increases, annual bonus calculations, and long-term incentive plans. Support eligible employees and managers during annual compensation cycles and ad-hoc reward requests. Conduct offers and compensation package analysis to ensure alignment with internal frameworks and market benchmarks. Salary Benchmarking & Market Analysis Lead participation in salary surveys and compensation benchmarking exercises using Korn Ferry methodologies. Provide required data for market surveys and conduct post-survey analysis to support salary structure updates. Support the design and annual review of salary grids and pay ranges based on survey outcomes. Data Analytics & Reporting Develop and deliver total rewards reports, dashboards, and insights related to compensation costs, salary positioning, and reward effectiveness. Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across HR systems and reports. Provide analytical insights to support decision-making in rewards, budgeting, and workforce planning. Governance & Cross-Functional Collaboration Ensure total rewards processes comply with internal policies, approved frameworks, and labor regulations. Collaborate closely with Payroll, Finance, Talent Management, and HR Operations teams to ensure smooth execution of reward-related processes. Act as a point of escalation for complex compensation and rewards-related cases. Team Supervision & Functional Leadership Provide guidance, task prioritization, and quality review for Total Rewards team members. Review work outputs related to job evaluation, salary benchmarking, budgeting, and annual reward cycles to ensure accuracy and compliance. Coach team members on compensation methodologies, job evaluation frameworks, and data analysis best practices. Act as a functional reference point for complex total rewards cases and escalate critical matters to the Total Rewards & HR Operations Manager when required. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in business, Human Resources, Finance, or a related field. 5–7 years of experience in compensation, benefits, or total rewards, with exposure to supervisory responsibilities. Proven experience in salary surveys, benchmarking, and job evaluation. Strong experience working with HR systems and advanced Excel models. Solid understanding of labor law and HR compliance practices. Korn Ferry Job Evaluation Certification is a must. Benefits Embark on an exciting journey with the Fin-Tech Experts. Join a workplace that actively encourages and supports all talents. A support system where you have a safe place to voice your opinion, share feedback, and be your true authentic self. Join us in our mission to accelerate financial inclusion and make financial freedom accessible to all. Show more Show less
